column4: is there a page somewhere that explains how to upgrade to breezy via apt-get?
was upgrading via apt-get but lost network, so for a lot of packages it shows timeout errors now.. will it fetch those later?
it will carry on from where it got to, don't worry.
try using "ftp://" instead of "http://" in your /etc/apt/sources.list - that can help if the web server is overloaded
is was my router that went down :-.
this apt-get thing is scarily intelligent..
sorry, i try to ask as little as possible but keep coming back.. *how* do i add the cd to that file?
now you're asking!  maybe you put "deb       file:/media/iso/ubuntu/              breezy          main restricted" in /etc/apt/sources.list ?
i'll try that, thanks. did you get that online somewhere?
if so, where and i'll write it down :)
no.  I got that from my own sources.list, which I got when I installed hoary.  I've since replaced 'hoary' with 'breezy' and commented that CD line out...
hence the '?' at the end of my suggestion...  but it looks like it should work, don't you think?
ok, thanks. i'll backup the file next time i change it..
